text:
I am compiling code using the ANT plugin in WSAD 5.1.1ie and have the J2SDK 
1.4.1_07 installed.

When I run the ant tool and it executes the "javac" task, it throws the 
following error:

       [javac] ..\SessionListener.java:273: cannot resolve symbol
       [javac] symbol  : method getValue ()
       [javac] location: class javax.servlet.http.HttpSessionBindingEvent
       [javac] 		Class attr = arg0.getValue().getClass();
       [javac]                                      ^
       [javac] Note: Some input files use or override a deprecated API.
       [javac] Note: Recompile with -deprecation for details.
       [javac] 3 errors
       [javac] BUILD FAILED: file:C:/ANT/AntBuilder/build.xml:63: Compile 
failed; see the compiler error output for details.

I am unable to build the .ear file due to this.
creator: morpheus.blr@gmail.com

text:
The same codebase when built using the 'Project->Rebuild All' option and on 
starting the web server locally, throws up no errors.
creator: morpheus.blr@gmail.com
antoine@apache.org
text:
This is not an ant bug. Probably your classpath in the build.xml does not match the classpath used by 
WSAD to compile.
You probably have a "servlet.jar" or "j2ee.jar" in the compilation classpath in build.xml.
Check from which J2EE version it comes.
The method getValue() is present starting with the servlet API 2.3 but not in 2.2.
http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.3/javadoc/javax/servlet/http/HttpSessionBindingEvent.html
http://java.sun.com/products/servlet/2.2/javadoc/javax/servlet/http/HttpSessionBindingEvent.html

Closing this bug report as invalid.
